title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: package provides set color palettes widely used. different packages used different tools, including: viridis viridis package brewer.pal.info RColorBrewer package ggsci_db ggsci package redmonder.pal.info Redmonder package metacartocolors rcartocolor package nord_palettes nord package ocean palettes syspals pals package colorschemes dichromat package custom palettes including jcolors package palettes provided SCP package. addition, SCP package also provides set color palettes widely used single-cell analysis, including: discrete colour palettes DiscretePalette Seurat package scales::hue_pal used Seurat See also following documentation details: available color palettes show_palettes palette_this

what: Basic implementation of the plotting functions
title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: plotting functions plotthis implemented following structure:
code: SomePlot <- function(     data,     # The column to split the data and plot     # When `facet` is TRUE, the columns specified here will be used to facet the plot     # When `facet` is FALSE, the columns specified here will be used to split the data     #   and generate multiple plots and combine them into one     # If multiple columns are specified     #   When `facet` is TRUE, up to 2 columns are allowed. If one column,     #     `ggplot2::facet_wrap` is used, the number of rows and columns is determined     #     by `nrow` and `ncol`     #   When `facet` is FALSE, a warning will be issued and the columns will be     #     concatenated into one column, using `split_by_sep` as the separator     split_by, split_by_sep,     # Columns to group the data for plotting     # For those plotting functions that do not support multiple groups,     # They will be concatenated into one column, using `group_by_sep` as the separator     group_by, group_by_sep,     # Whether to facet the plot, or split the data and combine the plots     facet, facet_scales,     # Controls for theming     theme, theme_args, palette, palcolor, keep_empty, x_text_angle, aspect.ratio,     legend.position, legend.direction, alpha, title, subtitle, xlab, ylab,     # The number of rows and columns when `facet_wrap` is used or     # when `facet` is FALSE, the number of rows and columns to combine the plots     # For facet_wrap, dir = 'v' will be used when byrow = FALSE     combine, nrow, ncol, byrow     # Whether to guess the width and height of the plot in pixels     # list(plot, width, height) will be returned instead of the plot if TRUE     seed,     ... ) {      # Argument validation      # Data preparation     #   Data will be transformed based on the arguments     #   and split into a list of data frames by split_by      # Plot for each split data frame     plots <- lapply(split_data, function(df) {         # Calling atomic plotting functions to generate the plot         #   These functions do not need to handle split         #   All data passed to these functions should feed to the plot         SomePlotAtomic(df, ...)     })      # Combine the plots     #     patch_work::wrap_plots(plots, nrow, ncol, byrow) }

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: Unlike plotting packages, plotthis provides unified interface splitting faceting. plots created ggplot2 behind scenes, plotthis “facet-aware”. plotting functions plotthis support splitting faceting. split_by argument used split data generate multiple plots, data split_by columns used split data generate multiple plots, combined one plot. sub-plots independent , scales guides. addition, split_by_sep argument used concatenate columns specified split_by one column, using specified separator. palettes/palcolors can different sub-plot using palette/palcolor argument. faceting, facet_scales argument used control scales facets. facet_wrap function used facet_by one column; otherwise, facet_grid function used facet_by two columns. plots support faceting (built directly based ggplot2), split_by good choice split data generate multiple plots.

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: arguments plotting functions named consistent way. _ used separate words argument names, favor ., unless argument passed ggplot2 function (e.g. theme). _ used separate words argument names make argument names readable less confusing . function names, work method call. argument names lowercased.

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: plots created plotthis come height width attribute. experimental feature used guess size plot inches. Note actual size plot. just guess based elements plot. can use values set fig.width fig.height arguments chunk options R Markdown options(repr.plot.width = ...) options(repr.plot.height = ...) Jupyter notebooks. can also use save plot file guessed size. example:
code: p <- SomePlot(x, ...) png("plot.png", width = attr(p, "width") * 100, height = attr(p, "height") * 100, res = 100) print(p) dev.off()

what: Tracing the ggplot calls for debugging
title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: plot created ggplot2 behind scenes, plotthis relies gglogger package trace ggplot2 calls. gglogger package used log ggplot2 calls arguments passed ggplot2 functions. useful debugging understanding plot created.
code: options(plotthis.gglogger.enabled = TRUE)  p <- BarPlot(data = iris, x = "Species") p$logs  # ggplot2::ggplot(data, aes(x = !!sym(x), y = !!sym(y), fill = !!sym(x))) + #   geom_col(alpha = alpha, width = width) + #   scale_fill_manual(name = x, values = colors, guide = guide) + #   labs(title = title, subtitle = subtitle, x = xlab %||% x, y = ylab %||% #     y) + #   scale_x_discrete(drop = !keep_empty, expand = expand$x) + #   scale_y_continuous(expand = expand$y) + #   do.call(theme, theme_args) + #   ggplot2::theme(aspect.ratio = aspect.ratio, legend.position = legend.position, #     legend.direction = legend.direction, panel.grid.major = element_line(colour = "grey80", #         linetype = 2), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = x_text_angle, #         hjust = just$h, vjust = just$v)) + #   coord_cartesian(ylim = c(y_min, y_max))

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: extra data needed plotting, plotthis usually provides argument receive . can prepare data attached attribute main data frame, pass @extra argument. function can access extra data attr(data, "extra"). example:
code: data <- gsea_result attr(data, "gene_ranks") <- gene_ranks attr(data, "gene_sets") <- gene_sets GSEAPlot(data)  # Equivalent to GSEAPlot(data, gene_ranks = gene_ranks, gene_sets = gene_sets)

what: High-Level Plotting Built Upon ggplot2 and Other Plotting Packages
title: High-Level Plotting Built Upon ggplot2 and Other Plotting Packages
text: plotthis R package built upon ggplot2 plotting packages. provides high-level APIs wide range options create stunning, publication-quality plots effortlessly.

title: High-Level Plotting Built Upon ggplot2 and Other Plotting Packages
text: can also install package using conda:
code: install.packages("plotthis") # or to install the latest version: remotes::install_github("pwwang/plotthis") devtools::install_github("pwwang/plotthis") $ conda install pwwang::r-plotthis

title: Area plot — AreaPlot
code: AreaPlot(   data,   x,   y = NULL,   x_sep = "_",   split_by = NULL,   split_by_sep = "_",   group_by = NULL,   group_by_sep = "_",   group_name = NULL,   scale_y = FALSE,   theme = "theme_this",   theme_args = list(),   palette = "Paired",   palcolor = NULL,   alpha = 1,   facet_by = NULL,   facet_scales = "fixed",   facet_ncol = NULL,   facet_nrow = NULL,   facet_byrow = TRUE,   x_text_angle = 0,   aspect.ratio = 1,   legend.position = waiver(),   legend.direction = "vertical",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   keep_empty = FALSE,   seed = 8525,   combine = TRUE,   nrow = NULL,   ncol = NULL,   byrow = TRUE,   axes = NULL,   axis_titles = axes,   guides = NULL,   design = NULL,   ... )

title: Area plot — AreaPlot
text: data data frame. x character string specifying column name data frame plot x-axis. y character string specifying column name data frame plot y-axis. x_sep character string concatenate columns x, multiple columns provided. split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by group_by Columns group data plotting plotting functions support multiple groups, concatenated one column, using group_by_sep separator group_by_sep separator multiple group_by columns. See group_by group_name character string name legend fill. scale_y logical value scale y-axis total number x-axis group. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. x_text_angle numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. keep_empty logical value indicating whether keep empty groups. FALSE, empty groups removed. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments.

code: # \donttest{ set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100)) data$y <- rnorm(100, 10, sd = 0.5) data$z <- -data$x + data$y + rnorm(100, 20, 1) data$g <- sample(1:4, 100, replace = TRUE)  CorPairsPlot(data, diag_type = "histogram", diag_args = list(bins = 30, palette = "Paired"),  layout = "/.")   CorPairsPlot(data, group_by = "g", diag_type = "none", layout = "./",  theme_args = list(axis.title = element_textbox(      color = "black", box.color = "grey20", size = 16, halign = 0.5, fill = "grey90",      linetype = 1, width = grid::unit(1, "npc"), padding = ggplot2::margin(5, 5, 5, 5))))   CorPairsPlot(data, group_by = "g", diag_type = "violin", layout = "\\.",   cor_format = "{x}\n{y}\ncorr: {round(corr, 2)}")   CorPairsPlot(data, split_by = "g", diag_type = "none", layout = ".\\",  legend.position = "bottom", legend.direction = "horizontal", group_name = "group")   CorPairsPlot(data, split_by = "g",  palcolor = list("1" = "red", "2" = "blue", "3" = "green", "4" = "yellow"))  # }

code: # \donttest{ set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(     F1 = rnorm(100, 0.1),     F2 = rnorm(100, 0.2),     F3 = rnorm(100),     F4 = rnorm(100, 0.3),     F5 = rnorm(100, -0.1),     F6 = rnorm(100, -0.2),     c = sample(letters[1:8], 100, replace = TRUE),     s = sample(LETTERS[1:2], 100, replace = TRUE),     p = sample(c("X", "Y", "Z"), 100, replace = TRUE),     a = sample(1:5, 100, replace = TRUE),     p1 = c(sample(c(1, NA), 100, replace = TRUE)),     p2 = c(sample(c(1, NA), 100, replace = TRUE)),     p3 = c(sample(c(1, NA), 100, replace = TRUE)) ) rows <- c("F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F5", "F6") rows_data <- data.frame(     rows = rep(c("F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F5", "F6"), each = 10),     rows1 = rep(c("F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F5", "F6"), each = 10),     rs = rep(letters[1:2], each = 30),     rp = sample(c("X", "Y", "Z"), 60, replace = TRUE),     rv = rnorm(60, 0.5) )  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = list(RG1 = c("F1", "F2", "F3"), RG2 = c("F4", "F5", "F6")),         columns_by = "c"     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     # Multiple columns_by, each as a split     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = c("c", "s"), columns_by_sep = "/") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = c("p1", "p2", "p3")) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", split_by = "s",         upper_cutoff = 2, lower_cutoff = -2, legend.position = c("none", "right"),         design = "AAAAAA#BBBBBBB"     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c", columns_split_by = "s") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", columns_split_by = "s",         rows_data = rows_data, rows_split_by = "rs"     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", columns_split_by = "s",         rows_data = rows_data, rows_split_by = "rs", flip = TRUE     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "bars") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "bars",         bars_sample = 3     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "label",         label = function(x) scales::number(x, accuracy = 0.01)     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "label",         label = function(x) ifelse(x <= 0, NA, scales::number(x, accuracy = 0.01))     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "dot") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "dot",         dot_size = mean     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "dot",         dot_size = mean, row_name_annotation = FALSE, column_name_annotation = FALSE,         row_names_side = "left", cluster_rows = FALSE, cluster_columns = FALSE     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "dot",         dot_size = mean, add_bg = TRUE     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "dot",         dot_size = mean, add_reticle = TRUE     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         cluster_rows = FALSE, cluster_columns = FALSE, columns_by = "p",         rows = c("p1", "p2", "p3"), name = "Category", pie_group_by = "c",         cell_type = "pie"     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data,         cluster_rows = FALSE, cluster_columns = FALSE, columns_by = "p",         rows = c("p1", "p2", "p3"), name = "Category", pie_group_by = "c",         cell_type = "pie", pie_size = sqrt, add_bg = TRUE     ) }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "violin") }  if (requireNamespace("cluster", quietly = TRUE)) {     Heatmap(data, rows = rows, columns_by = "c", cell_type = "boxplot") }  if code: # \donttest{ set.seed(1000)  nsim <- 50000  simdata <- data.frame(   "chromosome" = sample(c(1:22,"X"), size = nsim, replace = TRUE),   "position" = sample(1:100000000, size = nsim),   "P.value" = rbeta(nsim, shape1 = 5, shape2 = 1)^7,   "cohort" = sample(c("A", "B"), size = nsim, replace = TRUE) ) simdata$chromosome <- factor(simdata$chromosome, c(1:22, "X")) options(repr.plot.width=10, repr.plot.height=5)  if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    title = "Simulated P.Values", ylab = "P") }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # split_by ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    title = "Simulated P.Values", ylab = "P", split_by = "cohort", ncol = 1) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Customized p-value transformation and significance threshold line colors ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    title = "Simulated -Log2 P.Values", ylab = "-log2(P)", pval_transform = "-log2",    signif_color = c("red", "blue")) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Use a different palette and don't show significance threshold labels ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    palette = "Set1", signif_label = FALSE) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Reverse the palette and show significance threshold labels on the right ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    palette = "Set1", palreverse = TRUE, signif_label_pos = "right") }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Use chromosomes to show a single selected chromosome ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    title = "Simulated P.Values", chromosomes = 5) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Subset and reorder chromosomes ManhattanPlot(    simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",    title = "Simulated P.Values", chromosomes = c(20, 4, 6)) }   tmpdata <- data.frame(   "chromosome" = c(rep(5, 10), rep(21, 5)),   "position" = c(sample(250000:250100, 10, replace = FALSE),     sample(590000:600000, 5, replace = FALSE)),   "P.value" = c(10^-(rnorm(10, 100, 3)), 10^-rnorm(5, 9, 1)),   "cohort" = c(rep("A", 10), rep("B", 5)) )  simdata <- rbind(simdata, tmpdata) simdata$chromosome <- factor(simdata$chromosome, c(1:22, "X"))  if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Don't rescale the plot (y-axis) ManhattanPlot(     simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",     title = "Simulated P.Values - Significant", rescale = FALSE) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Rescale the plot (y-axis) and put the breaking point in the middle of the y-axis ManhattanPlot(     simdata, pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",     title = "Simulated P.Values - Significant", rescale = TRUE, signif_rel_pos = 0.5) }   sig <- simdata$P.value < 5e-07  simdata$label <- "" simdata$label[sig] <- sprintf("Label: %i", 1:sum(sig)) simdata$label2 <- "" i <- (simdata$chromosome == 5) & (simdata$P.value < 5e-8) simdata$label2[i] <- paste("Chromosome 5 label", 1:sum(i))  if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Label the points with labels ManhattanPlot(simdata, label_by = "label", pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome",     pos_by = "position", title = "Simulated P.Values with labels", label_size = 4) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Label the points with labels and use a different color for the labels ManhattanPlot(simdata, label_by = "label2", pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome",     pos_by = "position", title = "Simulated P.Values with labels",     label_size = 3, label_fg = "black") }   simdata$color <- "Not Significant" simdata$color[simdata$P.value <= 5e-8] <- "Significant"  if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Highlight points with shapes ManhattanPlot(simdata, title = "Highlight Points with shapes",     pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",     highlight = "color == 'Significant'", highlight_color = NULL, highlight_shape = 6,     highlight_size = 5, pt_alpha = 0.2, pt_size = 1) }   if (requireNamespace("ggmanh", quietly = TRUE)) { # Highlight points with colors ManhattanPlot(simdata, title = "Highlight Points",     pval_by = "P.value", chr_by = "chromosome", pos_by = "position",     highlight = "color == 'Significant'", highlight_color = "black",     pt_color = "lightblue", pt_alpha = 0.2, pt_size = 0.1) }  # }

title: QQ plot — QQPlot
code: set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(norm = rnorm(100))  QQPlot(data, val = "norm", band = TRUE)  QQPlot(data, val = "norm", band = list(     list(bandType = "ks", mapping = ggplot2::aes(fill = "KS"), alpha = 0.3),     list(bandType = "ts", mapping = ggplot2::aes(fill = "TS")),     list(bandType = "pointwise", mapping = ggplot2::aes(fill = "Normal")),     list(bandType = "boot", mapping = ggplot2::aes(fill = "Bootstrap")) ), band_alpha = 0.6)   data(airquality, package = "datasets") di <- "exp" # exponential distribution dp <- list(rate = 2) # exponential rate parameter QQPlot(airquality, val = "Ozone",     band = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp),     line = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp),     point = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp) )   de <- TRUE # enabling the detrend option QQPlot(airquality, val = "Ozone",     band = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp, detrend = de),     line = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp, detrend = de),     point = list(distribution = di, dparams = dp, detrend = de) )   QQPlot(data, val = "norm", type = "pp", band = TRUE)   dp <- list(mean = 2, sd = 2) # shifted and rescaled Normal parameters QQPlot(data, val = "norm", type = "pp",     band = list(dparams = dp),     point = list(dparams = dp))   QQPlot(data, val = "norm", type = "pp", band = TRUE,     line = list(ab = c(.2, .5)))   di <- "exp" dp <- list(rate = .022) # value is based on some empirical tests de <- TRUE QQPlot(airquality, val = "Ozone", type = "pp",    band = list(distribution = di, detrend = de, dparams = dp),    line = list(detrend = de),    point = list(distribution = di, detrend = de, dparams = dp),    ylim = c(-.5, .5) )

title: ROC curve — ROCCurve
text: data data frame. truth_by character string column name contains true class labels. (.k.. binary outcome, 1/0 TRUE/FALSE.) score_by character strings column names contains predicted scores. multiple columns provided, ROC curve plotted column. pos_label character string positive class label. NULL, labels handled plotROC package. split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by group_by Columns group data plotting plotting functions support multiple groups, concatenated one column, using group_by_sep separator group_by_sep separator multiple group_by columns. See group_by group_name character string name legend ROC curve groups. x_axis_reverse logical reverse x-axis, 1 0. percent logical display x y axis percentages. ci list arguments pass plotROC::geom_rocci() add confidence intervals. NULL, confidence intervals added. n_cuts integer specify number cutpoints ROC curve. quantiles predicted scores. cutoffs_at Vector user supplied cutoffs plot points. non-NULL, override values n_cuts plot observed cutoffs closest user-supplied ones. cutoffs_at cutoffs.labels passed plotROC::geom_roc(). numeric values, following special values allowed. values methods OptimalCutpoints::optimal.cutpoints(), literally: "CB" (cost-benefit method); "MCT" (minimizes Misclassification Cost Term); "MinValueSp" (minimum value set Specificity); "MinValueSe" (minimum value set Sensitivity); "ValueSe" (value set Sensitivity); "MinValueSpSe" (minimum value set Specificity Sensitivity); "MaxSp" (maximizes Specificity); "MaxSe" (maximizes Sensitivity); "MaxSpSe" (maximizes Sensitivity Specificity simultaneously); "MaxProdSpSe" (maximizes product Sensitivity Specificity Accuracy Area); "ROC01" (minimizes distance ROC plot point (0,1)); "SpEqualSe" (Sensitivity = Specificity); "Youden" (Youden Index); "MaxEfficiency" (maximizes Efficiency Accuracy, similar minimize Error Rate); "Minimax" (minimizes frequent error); "MaxDOR" (maximizes Diagnostic Odds Ratio); "MaxKappa" (maximizes Kappa Index); "MinValueNPV" (minimum value set Negative Predictive Value); "MinValuePPV" (minimum value set Positive Predictive Value); "ValueNPV" (value set Negative Predictive Value); "ValuePPV" (value set Positive Predictive Value); "MinValueNPVPPV" (minimum value set Predictive Values); "PROC01" (minimizes distance PROC plot point (0,1)); "NPVEqualPPV" (Negative Predictive Value = Positive Predictive Value); "MaxNPVPPV" (maximizes Positive Predictive Value Negative Predictive Value simultaneously); "MaxSumNPVPPV" (maximizes sum Predictive Values); "MaxProdNPVPPV" (maximizes product Predictive Values); "ValueDLR.Negative" (value set Negative Diagnostic Likelihood Ratio); "ValueDLR.Positive" (value set Positive Diagnostic Likelihood Ratio); "MinPvalue" (minimizes p-value associated statistical Chi-squared test measures association marker binary result obtained using cutpoint); "ObservedPrev" (closest value observed prevalence); "MeanPrev" (closest value mean diagnostic test values); "PrevalenceMatching" (value predicted prevalence practically equal observed prevalence). cutoffs_labels vector user-supplied labels cutoffs. Must character vector length cutoffs_at. cutoffs_accuracy numeric specify accuracy cutoff values show. cutoffs_pt_size numeric specify size cutoff points. cutoffs_pt_shape numeric specify shape cutoff points. cutoffs_pt_stroke numeric specify stroke cutoff points. cutoffs_labal_fg character string specify color cutoff labels. cutoffs_label_size numeric specify size cutoff labels. cutoffs_label_bg character string specify background color cutoff labels. cutoffs_label_bg_r numeric specify radius background cutoff labels. show_auc character string specify position AUC values. "auto" (default): Automatically determine position based plot. single group 'facet_by' provided, AUC placed plot. Otherwise, AUC placed legend. "none": display AUC values. "legend": Display AUC values legend. "plot": Display AUC values plot (left/right bottom corner). auc_accuracy numeric specify accuracy AUC values. auc_size numeric specify size AUC values displayed plot. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". Default TRUE. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. seed random seed use. title: ROC curve — ROCCurve
text: patch_work::wrap_plots object list combine FALSE. can retrieve AUC values using attr(p, "auc") combine TRUE. combine FALSE, AUC value plot can retrieved using attr(p[[]], "auc").

title: ROC curve — ROCCurve
code: set.seed(8525)  D.ex <- rbinom(200, size = 1, prob = .5) M1 <- rnorm(200, mean = D.ex, sd = .65) M2 <- rnorm(200, mean = D.ex, sd = 1.5) gender <- c("Male", "Female")[rbinom(200, 1, .49) + 1]  data <- data.frame(D = D.ex, D.str = c("Healthy", "Ill")[D.ex + 1],   gender = gender, M1 = M1, M2 = M2)  ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1")  # will warn about the positive label ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D.str", score_by = "M1") #> Warning: 'pos_label' is NULL, value 'Ill' from 'D.str' will be used as the positive label.  ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", increasing = FALSE)  # Multiple ROC curves ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = c("M1", "M2"), group_name = "Method")  ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", group_by = "gender", show_auc = "plot")  # Reverse the x-axis and display the axes as percentages ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", x_axis_reverse = TRUE, percent = TRUE)  # Pass additional arguments to geom_roc and make the curve black ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", n_cuts = 10, palcolor = "black")  # Add confidence intervals ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", ci = list(sig.level = .01))  # Facet by a column ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", facet_by = "gender")  # Show cutoffs ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", cutoffs_at = c(0, "ROC01", "SpEqualSe"))  # Split by a column p <- ROCCurve(data, truth_by = "D", score_by = "M1", split_by = "gender") p  # Retrieve the AUC values attr(p, "auc") #>   PANEL group ..group       AUC gender #> 1     1     1         0.8779167 Female #> 2     1     1         0.9039616   Male # Retrieve the cutoffs attr(p, "cutoffs") #>      specificity gender   #> [1,] numeric,0   "Female" #> [2,] numeric,0   "Male"

Default TRUE. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. ... code: set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(    x = c(rnorm(250, -1), rnorm(250, 1)),    group = rep(LETTERS[1:5], each = 100) ) RidgePlot(data, x = "x", group_by = "group") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.378  RidgePlot(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", reverse = TRUE) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.378   # wide form data_wide <- data.frame(    A = rnorm(100),    B = rnorm(100),    C = rnorm(100),    D = rnorm(100),    E = rnorm(100),    group = sample(letters[1:4], 100, replace = TRUE) ) RidgePlot(data_wide, group_by = LETTERS[1:5], in_form = "wide") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.337  RidgePlot(data_wide, group_by = LETTERS[1:5], in_form = "wide", facet_by = "group") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.429 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.367 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.416 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.428 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.429 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.367 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.416 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.428  RidgePlot(data_wide, group_by = LETTERS[1:5], in_form = "wide", split_by = "group",    palette = list(a = "Reds", b = "Blues", c = "Greens", d = "Purples")) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.429 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.416 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.367 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.428

title: Scatter Plot — ScatterPlot
code: set.seed(8525)  data <- data.frame(    x = rnorm(20),    y = rnorm(20),    w = abs(rnorm(20)),    t = sample(c("A", "B"), 20, replace = TRUE) ) ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y")   # highlight points ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", highlight = 'x > 0')   # size_by is a numeric column ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "w")   # color_by is a numeric column ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", color_by = "w")   # color_by is a factor/character column and set a border_color ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "w", color_by = "t",  border_color = "red")   # Same border_color as the fill color ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "w", color_by = "t",  border_color = TRUE)   # Shape doesn't have fill color ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", size_by = "w", color_by = "t",  shape = 1, palette = "Set1")   # Change color per plot ScatterPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", split_by = "t",             palcolor = list(A = "blue", B = "red"))

title: Cell velocity plot — VelocityPlot
text: embedding matrix data.frame dimension n_obs x n_dim specifying embedding coordinates cells. v_embedding matrix data.frame dimension n_obs x n_dim specifying velocity vectors cells. plot_type character string specifying type plot create. Options "raw", "grid", "stream". Default "raw". split_by optional character string specifying variable split plot . supported yet. group_by optional character string specifying variable group cells . group_name optional character string specifying name grouping variable legend. Default "Group". group_palette character string specifying color palette use grouping. Default "Paired". group_palcolor optional character vector specifying colors use grouping. NULL, colors generated group_palette. n_neighbors optional numeric value specifying number nearest neighbors grid point. Default ceiling(ncol(embedding) / 50). density optional numeric value specifying density grid points along dimension. Default 1. smooth optional numeric value specifying smoothing factor velocity vectors. Default 0.5. scale optional numeric value specifying scaling factor velocity vectors. Default 1. min_mass optional numeric value specifying minimum mass required grid point considered. Default 1. cutoff_perc optional numeric value specifying percentile cutoff removing low-density grid points. Default 5. arrow_angle optional numeric value specifying angle arrowheads degrees velocity arrows. Default 20. arrow_color character string specifying color velocity arrowheads. Default "black". arrow_alpha numeric value specifying transparency velocity arrows. Default 1 (fully opaque). works plot_type = "raw" plot_type = "grid". plot_type = "stream", use streamline_alpha instead. streamline_l optional numeric value specifying length velocity streamlines. Default 5. streamline_minl optional numeric value specifying minimum length velocity streamlines. Default 1. streamline_res optional numeric value specifying resolution velocity streamlines. Default 1. streamline_n optional numeric value specifying number velocity streamlines draw. Default 15. streamline_width numeric vector length 2 specifying width velocity streamlines. Default c(0, 0.8). streamline_alpha numeric value specifying transparency velocity streamlines. Default 1 (fully opaque). streamline_color character string specifying color velocity streamlines. streamline_palette character string specifying color palette use velocity streamlines. Default "RdYlBu". streamline_palcolor optional character vector specifying colors use velocity streamlines. NULL, colors generated streamline_palette. streamline_bg_color character string specifying background color velocity streamlines. Default "white". streamline_bg_stroke numeric value specifying background stroke width velocity streamlines. Default 0.5. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. return_layer logical value indicating whether return ggplot layer instead full plot. Default FALSE. seed random seed use. Default 8525.

FALSE, empty groups removed. expand values expand x y axes. like CSS padding. single value provided, used axes sides. two values provided, first value used top/bottom side second value used left/right side. three values provided, first value used top side, second value used left/right side, third value used bottom side. four values provided, values used top, right, bottom, left sides, respectively. can also use named vector specify values side. axis discrete, values applied 'add' 'expansion' function. axis continuous, values applied 'mult' 'expansion' function. However, "+/-" mixed "". values "x_asc", "x_desc", "alpha_asc", "alpha_desc", indicating order y axis. default list("+" = c("x_desc", "alpha_desc"), "-" = c("x_desc", "alpha_asc")), meaning positive values ordered x-axis values descending order alpha values descending order, negative values ordered x-axis values descending order alpha values ascending order. "*" key used order y axis without considering direction. bar_height numeric value indicating height bars. lineheight numeric value indicating height text. max_charwidth numeric value indicating maximum width text. fill_by character string indicating column name use fill bars. fill_by_sep character string concatenate fill columns multiple. fill_name character string indicating legend name fill. direction_pos_name character string indicating name positive direction. direction_neg_name character string indicating name negative direction. x_min numeric value indicating minimum value x axis. x_max numeric value indicating maximum value x axis.

code: # \donttest{ data <- data.frame(     x = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H"),     y = c(10, 8, 16, 4, 6, 12, 14, 2),     group = c("G1", "G1", "G2", "G2", "G3", "G3", "G4", "G4"),     facet = c("F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F1", "F2", "F3", "F4") )  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y")  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", fill_by_x_if_no_group = FALSE)  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", label = TRUE)  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", label = "facet", label_nudge = 1)  BarPlot(data, x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x")  BarPlot(data,     x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x",     position = "dodge", add_bg = TRUE )  BarPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", split_by = "group",     facet_by = "facet", position = "dodge", facet_ncol = 1 )  BarPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", split_by = "group", facet_by = "facet",     position = "dodge", facet_ncol = 1, guides = 'collect' )  BarPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", split_by = "group",     palette = list(G1 = "Reds", G2 = "Blues", G3 = "Greens", G4 = "Purp"),     facet_by = "facet", position = "dodge", facet_ncol = 1 )  BarPlot(data,     x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x",     position = "dodge", add_bg = TRUE, bg_palette = "Spectral" )  # use the count BarPlot(data, x = "group", ylab = "count")  # flip the plot BarPlot(data, x = "group", flip = TRUE, ylab = "count")  # } data <- data.frame(     word = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "date", "elderberry",              "It is a very long term with a lot of words"),     count = c(-10, 20, -30, 40, 50, 34),     score = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 3.2),     group = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C", "C") ) SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", alpha_by = "score")  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", alpha_by = "score",              max_charwidth = 30, lineheight = 1.1)  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", fill_by = "group")  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", facet_by = "group",              fill_name = "Direction")  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", alpha_by = "score", split_by="group",              palette = c(A = "Reds", B = "Blues", C = "Greens"))

title: Box / Violin Plot — BoxPlot
code: # \donttest{ set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(     x = rep(LETTERS[1:8], each = 40),     y = c(rnorm(160), rnorm(160, mean = 1)),     group1 = sample(c("g1", "g2"), 320, replace = TRUE),     group2 = sample(c("h1", "h2", "h3", "h4"), 320, replace = TRUE) )  BoxPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y")  BoxPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y",     stack = TRUE, flip = TRUE, facet_by = "group1",     add_bg = TRUE, bg_palette = "Paired" )  BoxPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y",     stack = TRUE, flip = TRUE, split_by = "group1",     add_bg = TRUE, bg_palette = "Paired",     palcolor = list(g1 = c("red", "blue"), g2 = c("blue", "red")) )   # wide form data data_wide <- data.frame(     A = rnorm(100),     B = rnorm(100),     C = rnorm(100) ) BoxPlot(data_wide, x = c("A", "B", "C"), in_form = "wide")  # } # \donttest{ ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y")  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_box = TRUE)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_point = TRUE)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_trend = TRUE)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_stat = mean)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_bg = TRUE)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_line = 0)  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", group_by = "group1")  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", group_by = "group1",     facet_by = "group2", add_box = TRUE ) #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes. #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes. #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes. #> Warning: Groups with fewer than two datapoints have been dropped. #> ℹ Set `drop = FALSE` to consider such groups for position adjustment purposes.  ViolinPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", add_point = TRUE, highlight = 'group1 == "g1"',     alpha = 0.8, highlight_size = 1.5, pt_size = 1, add_box = TRUE)  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", group_by = "group1",     comparisons = TRUE, sig_label = "p = {p}" )  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", sig_label = "p.format", hide_ns = TRUE,     facet_by = "group2", comparisons = list(c("D", "E")) )  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", fill_mode = "mean",     facet_by = "group2", palette = "Blues", multiplegroup_comparisons = TRUE ) #> Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation: fill. #> ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in #>   the data. #> ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical #>   variable into a factor? #> Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation: fill. #> ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in #>   the data. #> ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical #>   variable into a factor? #> Warning: The following aesthetics were dropped during statistical transformation: fill. #> ℹ This can happen when ggplot fails to infer the correct grouping structure in #>   the data. #> ℹ Did you forget to specify a `group` aesthetic or to convert a numerical #>   variable into a factor?  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", fill_mode = "mean",     split_by = "group1", palette = c(g1 = "Blues", g2 = "Reds") )  ViolinPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", stack = TRUE,     facet_by = "group2", add_box = TRUE, add_bg = TRUE,     bg_palette = "Paired" )  # }

TRUE, add lines plot show data distribution bottom. bar_height numeric value specifying height bars. actual height calculated based maximum density count. bar_alpha numeric value specifying alpha bars. bar_width numeric value specifying width bars. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. expand values expand x y axes. like CSS padding. single value provided, used axes sides. two values provided, first value used top/bottom side second value used left/right side. three values provided, first value used top side, second value used left/right side, third value used bottom side. four values provided, values used top, right, bottom, left sides, respectively. can also use named vector specify values side. axis discrete, values applied 'add' 'expansion' function. axis continuous, values applied 'mult' 'expansion' function. See also https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/expansion.html facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments. bins numeric value specifying number bins histogram. binwidth numeric value specifying width bins histogram. trend_skip_zero logical value. TRUE, skip zero count drawing trend line. use_trend logical value. TRUE, use trend line instead histogram. add_trend logical value. TRUE, add trend line histogram. trend_alpha numeric value specifying alpha trend line points trend_linewidth numeric value specifying width trend line trend_pt_size numeric value specifying size trend points

code: set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(     x = c(rnorm(500, -1), rnorm(500, 1)),     group = rep(c("A", "B"), each = 500),     facet = sample(c("F1", "F2"), 1000, replace = TRUE) )  DensityPlot(data, x = "x")  DensityPlot(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", facet_by = "facet")  DensityPlot(data, x = "x", split_by = "facet", add_bars = TRUE)  DensityPlot(data, x = "x", split_by = "facet", add_bars = TRUE,     palette = c(F1 = "Set1", F2 = "Set2"))  set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(     x = sample(setdiff(1:100, c(30:36, 50:55, 70:77)), 1000, replace = TRUE),     group = factor(rep(c("A", "B"), each = 500), levels = c("A", "B")),     facet = sample(c("F1", "F2"), 1000, replace = TRUE) )  Histogram(data, x = "x") #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", group_by = "group") #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", split_by = "facet", add_bars = TRUE) #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", add_trend = TRUE) #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", add_trend = TRUE, trend_skip_zero = TRUE) #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", split_by = "facet",  use_trend = TRUE, trend_pt_size = 3) #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  Histogram(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", split_by = "facet",  palette = c(F1 = "Paired", F2 = "Spectral")) #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

See group_by split_by character vector column names split data plot separately TRUE, split data features. feature plotted separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by pt_size numeric value point size. NULL, point size calculated based number data points. pt_alpha numeric value point transparency. Default 1. bg_color character string background NA points. Default "grey80". label_insitu Whether place raw labels (group names) center points corresponding group. Default FALSE, using numbers instead raw labels. show_stat Whether show number points subtitle. Default TRUE. label Whether show labels groups. Default FALSE. label_size numeric value label size. Default 4. label_fg character string label foreground color. Default "white". label_bg character string label background color. Default "black". label_bg_r numeric value background ratio labels. Default 0.1. label_repel Whether repel labels. Default FALSE. label_repulsion numeric value label repulsion. Default 20. label_pt_size numeric value label point size. Default 1. label_pt_color character string label point color. Default "black". label_segment_color character string label segment color. Default "black". highlight character vector row names highlight. Default NULL. highlight_alpha numeric value highlight transparency. Default 1. highlight_size numeric value highlight size. Default 1. highlight_color character string highlight color. Default "black". highlight_stroke numeric value highlight stroke. Default 0.5. add_mark Whether add mark plot. Default FALSE. mark_type character string mark type. Default "hull". mark_expand unit value mark expand. Default 3mm. mark_alpha numeric value mark transparency. Default 0.1. mark_linetype numeric value mark line type. Default 1. stat_by character string column name calculate statistics. Default NULL. stat_plot_type character string statistic plot type. title: Dot Plot / Scatter Plot / Lollipop Plot — DotPlot
text: data data frame. x character vector specifying column use x-axis. numeric column expected. y character vector specifying column use y-axis. factor/character column expected. x_sep character vector concatenate multiple columns x. Default "_". y_sep character vector concatenate multiple columns y. Default "_". flip logical value indicating whether flip x y axes. Default FALSE. split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by size_name character vector specifying name size legend. fill_name character vector specifying name fill legend. fill_cutoff_name character vector specifying name fill cutoff legend. add_bg logical value indicating whether add background color plot. Default FALSE. bg_palette character vector specifying palette background color. Default "stripe". bg_palcolor character vector specifying color background color. bg_alpha numeric value specifying alpha background color. Default 0.2. bg_direction character vector specifying direction background color. Default "vertical". options "horizontal". "h" "v" also accepted. size_by column use size dots. must numeric column. provided, size count instances 'y' 'x'. 'ScatterPlot', can single numeric value specify size dots. fill_by column use fill dots. must numeric column. provided, dots filled color middle palette. fill_cutoff numeric value specifying cutoff fill column. fill_reverse logical value indicating whether reverse fill direction. Default FALSE. default, fill direction "". TRUE, fill direction "". direction "", values less cutoff filled grey. direction "", values greater cutoff filled grey. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. x_text_angle numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. seed random seed use. Default 8525. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. keep_empty logical value indicating whether keep empty groups. FALSE, empty groups removed. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments.

title: GSEA plots — GSEASummaryPlot
text: data data frame GSEA results example, DOSE::gseDO(). Required columns ID, Description, NES, p.adjust, pvalue. ID column used match gene sets. in_form format input data fgsea: input data fgsea package. dose: input data DOSE package. auto: Automatically detect format input data. "leadingEdge" input data, treated "fgsea"; otherwise, "core_enrichment" input data, treated "dose". gene_ranks numeric vector gene ranks genes names gene ranks used plot gene sets. gene_ranks character vector starting @, gene ranks taken attribute data. gene_sets list gene sets, typically record GMT file names list match ID column data. gene_sets character vector starting @, gene sets taken attribute data. GSEA plots plotted gene set. , number plots number gene sets. want plot subset gene sets, can subset gene_sets passing function. top_term integer select top terms metric metric use significance terms Typically column name p values adjusted p values. also used select top terms. cutoff cutoff significance terms terms filtered cutoff; filtered top_term ranked metric. cutoff used show significance terms plot. terms significant, color grey. character_width width characters y-axis line_plot_size size line plots metric_name name metric show color bar nonsig_name name legend nonsignificant terms linewidth width lines line plots line_by method calculate line plots. prerank: Use gene ranks heights plot line plots. running_score: Use running score plot line plots. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). seed random seed use. Default 8525. ... Additional arguments. gs names gene sets plot NULL, gene sets gene_sets plotted. sample_coregenes logical value sample core genes core_enrichment; FALSE, first n_coregenes used line_width width line running score plot line_alpha alpha line running score plot line_color color line running score plot n_coregenes number core genes label genes_label genes label. set, n_coregenes ignored label_fg color label text label_bg background color label label_bg_r radius background color label label_size size label text combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details.

else {         palcolor <- redmonder.pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       }       if (pal_category == "qual") {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       }     } else if (pal %in% rownames(metacartocolors)) {       pal_n <- metacartocolors[pal, "Max_n"]       palcolor <- carto_pal(name = pal, n = pal_n)       if (pal_category == nord_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"     } else if (pal %in% names(viridis_palettes)) {       palcolor <- viridis_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- custom_palettes[[pal]]       if (pal %in% c("jet")) {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"       } else {         attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"       }     } else if (pal %in% names(seurat_discrete_palettes)) {       palcolor <- seurat_discrete_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "discrete"     } else if (pal %in% names(seurat_continuous_palettes)) {       palcolor <- seurat_continuous_palettes[[pal]]       attr(palcolor, "type") <- "continuous"     }     palette_list[[pal]] <- palcolor   } } # }

title: Process the enrichment results from Enrichr — prepare_enrichr_result
text: order use EnrichMap EnrichNetwork functions visualization functions plotthis, enrichment results Enrichr need processed prepare_enrichr_result function. following columns renamed: Term -> Description Genes -> geneID (separated replaced /) P.value -> pvalue Adjusted.P.value -> p.adjust Additionally, GeneRatio BgRatio columns inferred. enrichr's documentation, oddsRatio defined : oddsRatio = (* (D - B - C + ) / max((B - ) * (C - ), 1), overlapping genes; B total genes gene set; C (n_input) genes input list; D total genes background. D provided Enrichr. infer , D = oddsRatio * max((B - ) * (C - ), 1) / + B + C - . Overlap = / B (Enrichr) GeneRatio = / C (ClusterProfiler) BgRatio = B / D (ClusterProfiler) C (n_input), provided, inferred D terms equal. starting inferrence, minimum value try unique genes data$Genes/data$geneID.

title: Radar plot / Spider plot — RadarPlot
text: data data frame. x character string specifying column name data frame plot x-axis. x_sep character string concatenate columns x, multiple columns provided. group_by Columns group data plotting plotting functions support multiple groups, concatenated one column, using group_by_sep separator group_by_sep separator multiple group_by columns. See group_by y character string specifying column name data frame plot y-axis. group_name character string name legend group. scale_y y-axis scaled? Default "group". options "global", "x" "none". "group", y-axis scaled fraction within group. "global", y-axis scaled fraction total. "x", y-axis scaled fraction total within x-axis group. "none", y-axis scaled count x-axis group. y_min numeric value set minimum value y-axis. y_max numeric value set maximum value y-axis. y_nbreaks numeric value set number breaks y-axis. fill logical value fill polygons colors. linewidth numeric value set width lines. pt_size numeric value set size points. max_charwidth numeric value set maximum character width x labels. split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. named list vector can used specify palettes different split_by values. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. named list can used specify colors different split_by values. values missing, values palette used (palcolor NULL values). facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. axes string specifying axes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axes individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated axes placed run rows columns layout. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' remove duplicated x-axes columns duplicated y-axes rows respectively. axis_titles string specifying axis titltes treated. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'keep' retain axis titles individual plots. 'collect' remove duplicated titles one direction merge titles opposite direction. 'collect_x' 'collect_y' control x-axis titles y-axis titles respectively. guides string specifying guides treated layout. Passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. Options : 'collect' collect guides given nesting level, removing duplicates. 'keep' stop collection level let guides placed alongside plot. 'auto' allow guides collected upper level tries, place alongside plot . design Specification location areas layout, passed patchwork::wrap_plots(). relevant split_by used combine TRUE. specified, nrow, ncol, byrow ignored. See patchwork::wrap_plots() details. ... Additional arguments.

"counts": format counts provides x. x (required, multiple columns, x_sep used) columns plot x-axis. first element x ".", values links_fill_by (required) added plot first column nodes. useful show links flowed source targets. "auto" (default): Automatically determine format based columns provided. length x greater 1 x columns numeric, "counts" format used. length x greater 1 ggalluvial::is_alluvia_form returns TRUE, "alluvia" format used. Otherwise, "lodes" format tried. in_form character string specify format data. Possible values "auto", "long", "lodes", "wide", "alluvia", "counts". x character string specifying column name data frame plot x-axis. x_sep character string concatenate columns x, multiple columns provided. y character string specifying column name data frame plot y-axis. stratum character string column name group nodes x. See data details. stratum_sep character string concatenate columns stratum, multiple columns provided. alluvium character string column name define links. See split_by keep_empty logical value indicating whether keep empty groups. FALSE, empty groups removed. flow logical value use ggalluvial::geom_flow instead ggalluvial::geom_alluvium. expand values expand x y axes. like CSS padding. single value provided, used axes sides. two values provided, first value used top/bottom side second value used left/right side. three values provided, first value used top side, second value used left/right side, third value used bottom side. four values provided, values used top, right, bottom, left sides, respectively. can also use named vector specify values side. axis discrete, values applied 'add' 'expansion' function. axis continuous, values applied 'mult' 'expansion' function. = "Eye (links)", links_palcolor = c(         Brown = "#70493D", Hazel = "#E2AC76", Green = "#3F752B", Blue = "#81B0E4"))   data(Refugees, package = "alluvial") country_regions <- c(     Afghanistan = Africa",     Sudan = "Central Africa",     Syria = "Middle East",     Vietnam = "Southeast Asia" ) Refugees$region <- country_regions[Refugees$country] SankeyPlot(Refugees, x = "year", y = "refugees", text: SpatImagePlot: Plot SpatRaster object image. SpatMasksPlot: Plot SpatRaster object masks. SpatShapesPlot: Plot SpatVector object shapes. SpatPointsPlot: Plot data.frame points spatial coordinates.
